title: The Velvet Underground: The band that made an art of being obscure
description: The 60s rock band are the latest musicians to receive a renewed boost from a documentary.

title: Covid boosters: Who needs them and how do they help?
description: Millions are eligible for another Covid vaccine dose but remain confused about who needs them.

title: Charles Dickens House: 'It's like living in Victorian-era housing'
description: Some residents in Charles Dickens House say vermin and mould in their homes is harming their health.

title: Covid-19 in Brazil: 'My mum was used as a guinea pig'
description: A Brazilian healthcare provider is accused of conducting trials on Covid-19 patients without consent.

title: Laurie Cunningham: An electric trailblazer, Real Madrid's first British player
description: Laurie Cunningham was the first Briton to sign for Real Madrid, a pioneer at a time when there were few black players in the English game.

title: French fishermen warn of blockades in UK licence row
description: Why the fishermen of Boulogne-sur-Mer are angry at being refused licences to fish in British waters.

title: Climate change in India: The young inventor's solar-powered ironing cart
description: India's ironing vendors use charcoal as fuel, but Vinisha Umashankar's cart harnesses the Sun's energy.

title: Afghanistan: The New York rabbi evacuating desperate Afghans
description: Rabbi Moshe Margaretten says he gets calls in the middle of the night from people in Afghanistan asking for help.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: Robert Webb withdraws due to ill health
description: The comedian and author made the decision to leave the competition because of ill health.

title: Star Trek's William Shatner blasts into space on Blue Origin rocket
description: The actor who played Captain Kirk in the classic TV show is the oldest person ever to go to space.

title: The four-year-old girl from Bristol who has learned to unicycle
description: Daisy, who could ride a bike aged two, has thousands of fans online.

title: Insulate Britain: Angry motorists confront protesters at M25 junction
description: Police arrest more campaigners as Insulate Britain mounts its 13th day of road protests.

title: Shoppers told to plan ahead for Christmas amid port delays
description: The guidance comes as the UK's biggest commercial port Felixstowe, says the situation is improving.

title: Brexit: Irish deputy PM Leo Varadkar warns nations UK might not keep its word
description: Leo Varadkar speaks out after Dominic Cummings says the UK had never meant to stick to Brexit deal.

title: Brexit: EU to offer fewer Northern Ireland border checks on British goods
description: The UK says current rules impose too many barriers to the sale of chilled meats and other products.

title: Formula 1: Williams pledge to be climate positive and sustainable by 2030
description: Williams have announced plans to be climate positive by 2030, as the sport advances into becoming more sustainable.

title: Domestic violence: Mum begged for violent son to be taken away
description: A service supporting families in Wales saw a rise in "child on parent" domestic abuse in lockdown.

title: Sports Personality of the Year to take place live on BBC One on 19 December
description: The BBC Sports Personality of the Year show will take place live on BBC One on 19 December from MediaCity in Salford.

title: Brexit: What's the Northern Ireland Protocol?
description: The EU is outlining new proposals for the Northern Ireland Protocol.

title: Young to join Cardiff and becomes available for Wales
description: Flanker Thomas Young will join Cardiff next season from Wasps to link up with his father Dai and is available for Wales selection immediately.

title: UK economy boosted by holidays and dining out
description: GDP rose 0.4% in August in the first full month after all Covid restrictions were lifted in England.

title: China: Teenager apologises for impersonating boy to join band
description: Many fans have defended the girl and jokingly compared her to Chinese folk heroine Mulan.

title: Squid Game knocks Bridgerton off Netflix top spot
description: The Korean drama is Netflix's biggest debut hit, with 111 million users in its first 28 days.

title: Racism in the music industry 'is upfront and personal'
description: A new report says that 86% of black musicians have faced barriers because of their race.

title: Murray to skip Davis Cup after losing to Zverev at Indian Wells
description: Andy Murray loses in straight sets to Alexander Zverev at Indian Wells - then says he plans to skip next month's Davis Cup.

title: The Papers: Goods stuck at UK port, and Brexit deal offer
description: A mix of stories lead Wednesday's papers, including a warning over Christmas present shortages.

title: Mums of drug death teen and dealer become 'unlikely' friends
description: Kerry Roberts, whose daughter Leah died from taking MDMA, says hearing the "other side" was healing.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo: The making of 'The Greek Freak'
description: From the streets of Athens to NBA champion, how Giannis Antetokounmpo made it to the top of the NBA.

title: Denis Law statue in Aberdeen too heavy for proposed location
description: The council had agreed the tribute would be set near newly-refurbished Provost Skene's House in Aberdeen.

title: TikToker wins 'lumpy' oat milk war with Lidl
description: Scottish TikToker Luna campaigned for the store to recall a batch of the milk which she says was "smelly".

title: The children of IS: 'It's a disaster we cannot deal with'
description: Inside IS detention camps in Syria, officials say violence and radicalisation are a growing problem.

title: Care staff shortage worse than before pandemic, study shows
description: Reward care workers for their skills and dedication to avoid staff shortages, report urges.

title: What those living with dementia want people to know
description: "Dementia is something you learn to live with, not just die of," - tips from, those living with the condition.

title: What's the secret of a great comedy song?
description: As he launches a podcast on the science of funny songs, comedian Phil Nichol reveals his favourites.
